Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
All crew to your battle stations!
@BATTLE
Capitaine! May I trouble you for a second?
What's the issue, Émile?
Well... when I work on a new potential ship design, I usually come up with a name.
And?
Well, I'm stumped! I need help, Capitaine! Looking at the design itself, it looks like it should be called "Lu."
"Lu?"
Short for "Lucy!" A grand name for a grand ship! Don't you think?

Fields.MenuText: Lucy is a great name, Émile.
Why do you need my input on this, Émile?
Whatever you think is right, I'll agree. You're good at this kind of thing.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad you like it! If the mighty Capitaine likes it, then it's settled!
Because you're reliable, Capitaine! You'd never steer me wrong!
I-I am?! Merci! Merci beaucoup! I won't disappoint you! I promise!
I've decided! The name of this design is "Lu" and that's final!
You really needed me for this?
Emergency! We have a big emergency! Where is my capitaine?!
Is that Émile? I don't think we picked up any Morganas nearby... Do you sense enemy contacts?
Capitaine! Capitaine! We have a serious issue! Where-- oh! There you are!
Calm down, Émile. What's the problem?
C'est horrible! I've never faced such a troublesome predicament! It's my pencil!
Excuse me?
I've lost my pencil! My good luck pencil! The only utensil that helps me think properly!
You can always get another. Plenty of them in supply.
Non! It has to be this one! I can't focus without it! Can you please help me find it?

Fields.MenuText: When we're not knee-deep in Morgana territory I'll look around the ship.
Does it mean that much to you?
If it'll make you shut your-- I mean... I'll help if it will help you settle down and focus.

Fields.DialogueText: Oui! Merci, Capitaine! This means so much to me!
I need it to design! Without it... I cannot work!
It will, Capitaine. You're the only one I trust with this!
I'm guessing that until this pencil is found, *I* won't be getting any work done, either.
I believe I see several Morganas on approach, Capitaine. Say you leave these beasts to me and start the search for my pencil without me.
I'll leave the Morganas in your pencil less hands.
No need to rub it in...
@BATTLE
Morganas to the west, Captain!
Let's give them everything we've got!
@BATTLE
Capitaine... am I too mean? Too cruel?
You? Mean? What makes you think that?
I was writing to another Belle about her current situation. I evaluated her missions, how damaged she is...
And?
She's a submarine - complex but prone to constant failures, even in battle. So I proposed some potential fixes and improvements...
Ah, more of your famous critiques. I'm guessing that she wasn't a fan.
Non. I got a letter saying that I should mind my own business, and that I shouldn't contact her again.

Fields.MenuText: Not everyone can take feedback, Émile. It reflects on them, not you.
You meant well. Not every Belle is as giving as you are.
Want me to contact this Belle?

Fields.DialogueText: I guess you may have a point... but still...
I didn't mean to hurt her feelings...
That's sweet of you, Capitaine. But that's unnecessary.
You're not mean, Émile. How about we go to the cafeteria and you can tell me about some ideas for how I can improve?
Really?! Merci for your kindness, Capitaine.
If I was Émile's pencil, where would I hide...
Bonjour, Capitaine!
You startled me, Émile.
Pardonnez-moi! Anyway... I wanted to thank you for being so nice to me earlier!
That's not necessary, Émile. It's part of my duty to keep the crew--
Non! No excuses! I thought I'd thank you by introducing you to something just as entertaining as collecting Morgana scrap! Comics!
Comics?
We have some free time! I figured that I'd teach you about one of my favorite hobbies. Care to join me?

Fields.MenuText: I'd love to. Lead the way.
Maybe some other time.
As long as it doesn't take up too much time.

Fields.DialogueText: I can't believe you said yes! Get ready, Capitaine! You're about to experience true art!
Aww! Not only do you owe me a comic session, but you still have to find my pencil!
It won't, I promise! I'll be quick! Now let's go!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Another time. Duty calls!
I really have no idea what you're talking about, Miss Émile.
Oui? Are you sure? Because it looks awfully similar to mine...
It's not. Yours is much shorter than mine.
Sounds like Émile is causing trouble...
Ahem. Bonjour, Capitaine.
What are the two of you talking about?
Our Belle thinks that I'm using her pencil. She's been interrogating me for the past hour!
But it looks just like mine! Are you sure--
Positive.

Fields.MenuText: My crew doesn't steal, Émile.
Isn't your pencil riddled with bite marks, Émile?
It's obvious that it's not yours. Keep a cool head. You'll find it eventually.

Fields.DialogueText: That's true... I guess my mind is playing tricks on me. I miss my pencil...
That one is rather clean... I guess you're right, Capitaine!
I trust you, Capitaine! I guess I'm just getting lonely, is all...
All of this over a pencil... aren't we in the middle of a war?
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Émile really is impressive when fighting!
Impressive is a good word for it.
@BATTLE
Glad the battle is over...
Are you okay? You're usually more enthusiastic over a victory.
I've just been having a rough time... sleeping...
We've been over this before. You need sleep...
Je sais, je sais...
Émile?
Don't worry! I got you! Hey, Émile! Wake up!
Umm... thanks for catching me...

Fields.MenuText: Don't scare me like that, Émile. I was really worried...
You're going to sleep. No excuses. Feel free to use my quarters.
You look comfortable.

Fields.DialogueText: Je suis désolée, Capitaine. It won't happen again. I promise.
Okay... je suis désolée ...
Well... I guess I am...
You can't fight without rest, Émile. None of us can.
You're not eating your food. What's going on?
Émile!
Ahh! Désolée! I heard you! I've been having trouble coming up with potential ship designs! So I'm trying to think of some now!

Fields.MenuText: Forcing it won't help, Émile. Give it time.
I just want to make sure you're eating. You can do that while you think.
Don't overdo it, okay? I need you to stay alert.

Fields.DialogueText: You may have a point. I hope I can think of something...
Thank you for reminding me, Capitaine! Good thing the meal is still hot!
I'll try not to. I'll eat now, Capitaine.
Have you ever gone through this before?
Non. I haven't. It could be because I'm missing my lucky pencil!
You really think a pencil can cause that?
Peut-être. I'm not sure!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Bah! Ce n'est pas bon! Time to start again!
Émile? Sounds like it's coming from my quarters.
What are-- whoa! Why is my place covered in papers?
Pardonnez-moi, Capitaine! I needed a place to try to get my blueprint juices flowing! I thought your quarters would act as my new good luck charm!
I'm guessing that it hasn't?
I can't think of anything good. I got a new pencil and everything, but it's not the same...

Fields.MenuText: You have to take it easy, Émile. All you're doing is stressing yourself out.
Who's going to clean all this up?
You'll find your "lucky" pencil eventually.

Fields.DialogueText: Oui, I know...
Me! I wasn't going to leave your quarters in a mess! I would've cleaned it... eventually.
I hope it's soon! I'm going crazy without it!
*ALARM*
We are going to have to table this discussion.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Emile, did you not sense the Morganas?
Oui, Capitaine, but the alarm sounded before I could get to you.
@BATTLE
What are you doing here? Aren't you usually asleep by now?
Je suis totalement réveillée. I can't sleep! Can I bunk here tonight? I brought a ton of comics we could read!

Fields.MenuText: You can sleep here. Just don't cause too much trouble, okay?
Just try not to make a mess of the place...
Is a missing pencil really causing you to lose sleep?

Fields.DialogueText: Okay! Oops! That was loud! Sorry, Capitaine!
I won't! Now... where to put my comic pile...
Oui!
I have an idea, Capitaine!
What?
This is the perfect time for you to spend some time with my comics! Are you up for it?
Sure...
Yay!
Not so loud...
No sign of any Morganas in the vicinity, Captain.
Great work. Let's keep it that way.
"Sign. Sign. Sign."
How's everything else on the ship? Do we need to resupply anytime soon?
It can't hurt, Captain. The sooner we do it, the more safe we'll all feel.
"Safe. Safe. Safe."
Just what are you doing, Émile?
Trying to find inspiration, Capitaine! I figured that certain words could trigger something in my mind!

Fields.MenuText: I don't think it works like that...
Just to make sure... you are eating, correct?
Hopefully you'll think of something...

Fields.DialogueText: "Works. Works. Works."
"Eating. Eating. Eating."
"Something. Something. Something."
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Do you have a moment, Capitaine?
You seem different, Émile. What's going on?
I've been up later than usual. I'm not getting much sleep...
Something has to be wrong, Émile. You never overwork yourself this much.
I'm in a creative rut, Capitaine. It's wearing me down.

Fields.MenuText: You're focusing too hard, Émile. We do have a war...
Is there anything I can do to help?
I'm worried about you, Émile. I don't want to see you like this...

Fields.DialogueText: Je sais...
Your presence is good enough, Capitaine.
I didn't know you cared that much...
Can I still sleep in your quarters?
As long as it doesn't hinder the war effort, it's still fine with me.
Merci, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
Captain, enemy vessels have been picked up. Do we engage?
Absolutely. Sound the alarm.
@BATTLE
Capitaine! Come sit next to me!
You're awfully cheery. Are you scheming something?
Moi?! Never! I just got some new Morgana scrap to add to my collection!
You really like that stuff...
Anyway... I'd like to examine them... with you...
I'd like that, Émile.
Now, let's begin!
... zzzzzz.
Émile? You fell asleep on me...
S-sorry, Capitaine. Désolée. Can... can we stay like this for a bit longer?

Fields.MenuText: I was about to suggest the same thing.
Sure thing, Émile.
I could use a break...

Fields.DialogueText: O-oui?! I-I... thank you, Capitaine...
Yay! Now stop fidgeting around! I can't sleep!
Moi aussi...
You have been selected, Capitaine!
Selected for what?
For help with getting my creative juices flowing! Help me on my "Lucy" design!
If you think it'll help...
Formidable! Now, I've got most of the structural stuff out of the way... all that remains is the weapons. What do you think Lucy should have?

Fields.MenuText: Something gigantic... are cannons still in style?
Nothing too flashy, Émile. Just the usual... weapons that can take down Morganas.
Just make it a giant battering ram!

Fields.DialogueText: They are, Capitaine! That could work!
Come on! Use your imagination! Think big!
You know, that's so crazy it just might... never mind.
This discussion helped me a bit... but I still need my pencil.
*ALARM*
We'll continue this at a later time.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, this is a particularly vicious group of Morganas!
My money is still on you.
@BATTLE
You know, Capitaine... I've been curious about the Morganas...
Nothing surprising about that.
C'est vrai. But my mind is usually taken over by their strategies, their vessels, and their combat abilities.
You're thinking of something else?
It's obvious that the Morganas are capable. But why are they doing all this?

Fields.MenuText: What matters to me is that they're a threat that needs to be eliminated. I don't have time to wonder what goes through their heads.
I can't answer that. Why do you think they're fighting?
I always assumed that they just don't like us...

Fields.DialogueText: Hmm... I wish I could be like that. Maybe I'd get more sleep.
I don't know... it could be a misunderstanding. At least that's what I'd like to believe...
Simple answer... nothing wrong with that.
Do you think they'd appreciate you collecting their scrap?
Non. Most definitely not.
Morganas on the horizon!
@BATTLE
Captain! I believe you dropped this!
Huh? Dropped what? I didn't drop anything...
I assume this pencil is yours! It looks weathered down! I figured it was due to our hardworking captain!
Wait... this is Émile's! Where did you find it?
I found it near the bridge not too long ago. I've been looking for you. I thought that it was yours... but if it's the Belle's...
She's been looking for it for quite a while.

Fields.MenuText: Miss Émile will appreciate this. I'll tell her you were the one to find it.
Suspicious that you just happened to find it...
Now she'll quit driving us all crazy.

Fields.DialogueText: Suspicious?! Capitaine, I... I don't know how to respond to that!
Just happy to help.
I should probably get going...
Thanks, sailor. Dismissed.
What seems to be the issue, Captain? You look like you're in a hurry.
It's nothing. I'm just getting this pencil back to Émile.
Hopefully she'll stop interrogating the crew now. Funny that you bring up Émile, though. I wanted to chat with you about her.
Really? What did you want to talk about?
Your relationship with her. It's obvious that the both of you have gotten... close. I just want to remind you of our situation at hand.
Go on.
I just want to say that whatever the two of you are, keep it in private.

Fields.MenuText: Say no more.
I appreciate the advice, but I know how to handle myself.
I'd like it if you'd stay out of my personal affairs.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad you understand. Now let's get going. Émile has been looking for you.
I wasn't trying to threaten you, Captain. I just wanted to remind you that we are currently at war...
Okay. Don't blame me if things don't work out...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Capitaine, I am sensing a large group of Morganas close by.
Alert the crew.
@BATTLE
Émile? Where are you?
In your quarters again, Capitaine! I'm trying to think of improvements to my Lucy design!
I'd imagine you're still having trouble?
Oui, I am... without my lucky pencil... wait. What's that you're holding!?
Why, it's your pencil, Émile. I'm guessing you'd like it back?
Oui, oui, oui! Merci beaucoup, Capitaine! This is the greatest moment in my entire life!

Fields.MenuText: I'm glad to see you smiling again.
Can I have my cute, happy, and energetic Belle back?
I don't think I've ever seen you this happy before...

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad that you found it! I won't forget this moment, Capitaine!
Cute?! Me?! I-I-uh... y-yes...
You don't know how much this means to me...
Now if you'll excuse me, I have a lot of catching up to do!
Remember that letter I sent to that Belle?
I think so. She told you to stay out of her "business." Right?
C'est elle! Anyway, I wrote to her again!
Really? Why?
Well... I still want to help her get better... and I needed to apologize.
When did you send the letter?
Not too long ago. She actually wrote back!

Fields.MenuText: Oh boy, what does it say?
You know, it's best not to pester our allies.
How did it go?

Fields.DialogueText: Surprisingly, she accepted my apology and is open to feedback! I sent her some of my blueprints that could be potential upgrades for her!
I didn't this time! She wants my help! I tried to soften up my critiquing skills to be less... personal?
It went well! We're friends now!
You really have grown, Émile.
@BATTLE
How has your design process been?
Très bien! Better than I ever expected! I have so many wonderful ideas for future vessels!
I'm glad to hear that.
Only... It turns out I didn't need my pencil.

Fields.MenuText: What do you mean?
I told you so.
What did you need?

Fields.DialogueText: I was preoccupied with other thoughts at the time...
I knew you were right, Capitaine! I was thinking of something all this time. It blocked my mind up quite a bit.
Well...
Hey, Capitaine.
What?
I'm working on potential designs right now... could you stick around and watch me? Maybe give some advice?
Yes.
Fantastique!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Wait... what's that in your hand?
My pencil!
No, it's not. It looks brand new... did you get rid of the old one?
That's correct.

Fields.MenuText: But...  why?!
After all that work I did...
Are you feeling well?

Fields.DialogueText: It was getting in the way! I don't need it, remember?
Ne t'inquiète pas! I noticed how concerned you were for me! That's all that I needed to get through my rut!
Of course! Why do you ask?
You've matured, Émile...
You think so?!
There's no way the old you would've thrown away something that important to you.
Like I said, I found a new source of inspiration.
@BATTLE
I remember when you'd constantly forget to eat your food... but look at you now!
It's for the war effort, Capitaine! I'm working on upgrading myself into a better Belle!
Are you? Is that going to cost us?
No additional parts or Morgana scrap required! I start with remembering to eat! Then I move onto my most challenging task yet!
More challenging than the Morganas?
Oui! My final task in upgrading myself will be to sleep more often!

Fields.MenuText: That's quite the task.
You think sleep is a bigger challenge than the war?
I believe in you, Émile.

Fields.DialogueText: I can do it! Thanks to your guidance, Capitaine!
Bien sûr! Without proper rest, I can't fight! If I can't fight, I can't impress you!
Merci, Capitaine!
Captain, we've got Morganas on approach!
@BATTLE
Hold that sleep for now, Émile...
We have them on the run!
Let's keep it that way.
@BATTLE
Morganas... defeated... good job, everyone...
Do I detect a hint of drowsiness?
Uh... non! Well... yes... oui, Capitaine...
What happened to your plan of improving yourself?
I got so caught up in remembering to eat that I forgot to add more sleep into my schedule...

Fields.MenuText: Try writing a list of things to do for the day.
This is why I worry about you, Émile...
Maybe you should get some rest now. The fight is over.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmm... that might work! You're so wise, Capitaine!
You don't need to worry about me! I will overcome this obstacle! I promise!
That's a good idea...
Anyway, it appears as though I'm going through another rut.
Again?! What's it this time?!
J'ai trop sommeil... too sleepy. Talk later...
*ALARM*
All crew prepare for battle! Emile!
Je suis ici, Capitaine!
@BATTLE
I have a question for you, Capitaine.
What is it, Émile?
I think I know why I'm in another rut... but I need to confirm something with you.
Speak your mind.
What does it mean when you can't stop thinking about someone?
It depends.
I can't get this person out of my head... they're all I think about. I don't know...

Fields.MenuText: I know that feeling. Someone is constantly on my mind as well. She's very close to me.
I think you have feelings for someone, Émile. I think it's time you told the person what you think of them.
It's love.

Fields.DialogueText: Really?! I wonder... oh! I forgot that I haven't eaten today! Gotta run!
But that sounds so embarrassing! I need a drink first. Please excuse me...
What?! L-love?! My head is spinning! I need sleep... I'm hungry... I gotta go!
I'm ready, Capitaine.
Ready for?
My new inspiration is you, Capitaine.
You're my good luck charm... and I can't stop thinking about you... I care about you.
Émile-
I'm not done! I think you're incredibly kind and I feel safe around you! You make this world feel less scary!

Fields.MenuText: I feel the same way about you, Émile.
I knew all of that already. I have feelings for you, too.
You're even cute when you get flustered. I care about you, Émile.

Fields.DialogueText: Really?! Oh my goodness! What a relief! So... let's be together!
I had a feeling... I'm so happy, Capitaine.
Don't embarrass me like that! But... thank you, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I'm glad we're together, Capitaine.
I am too.
I think about all you've done for me. I appreciate it... you care about me... you really do.
Since the day we started working together I knew that you were special.
You're embarrassing me again... anyway, want to help me design? You are my good luck charm, after all.
Sure thing.
Does that mean we have to get up?
Yes.
Non. Forget it. I'm going to sleep. Wake me when the enemy is near!

Fields.MenuText: I guess I'll stay up while you get to sleep, then.
That's what alarms are for.
Sure. And you wake me up, too... zzz...

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, so we can both sleep in! Nice...
Merci, Capitaine...
I will... Capitaine... zzz...
